intro: Sacciolepis huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén sacciolepis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or arid habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
